newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Beverage shrs post gains on mixed Budapest bourse.
newsitem.headline: Beverage shrs post gains on mixed Budapest bourse.

text.p: Hungarian share prices closed mixed with gainers and losers roughly equally matched on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Monday, traders said.
Some of the recent gainers closed lower as investors decided to lock in profits after last week's gains, while other less liquid papers saw renewed demand for them.
The BUX index edged up 13.69 points to close at 3,714.68.
"The market was rather balanced with minor fluctations," Geza Raner of Bank Austria-GiroCredit Rt, said.
"Some profit-taking will characterise the whole week but I don't think the bourse's performance would be bad this month."
Chemicals company TVK shares fell 30 forints to finish at 1,580 as certain investors decided to lock in profits after last week's surge to a new high of 1,640 forints.
"There were signs already on Friday that the rally would not last long and today it reversed," Raner said. "The paper deserves this price but it had risen too fast."
Nevertheless, TVK and pharmaceuticals company Richter still have buyers, although the selling side seems gradually turning stronger in both.
Richter closed at 8,815 forints, up 135, but below the day's peak of 8,900.

The beverage sector did well on Monday, partly because they have thin free float thus when an investor wants to buy a substantial share package, has to pay a premium, but also benefiting from the generally good January-September results, announced in November.
Brewery Sopron rose five percent to 2,520 forints, while liquer maker Zwack gained almost two percent to finish at 2,600.
The bourse's first mineral water company, Kekkuti Rt debuted with its price hovering between 1,315 and 1,355 forints, trading above its subscription price of 1,280 forints.
